message: Week 11 Learning Outcomes identified: (1) Biological treatments (drugs, ECT, psychosurgery), (2) Psychodynamic therapies (insight, free association), (3) Humanistic therapies (Carl Rogers, person-centered), (4) Cognitive therapies (REBT, CBT, Beck), (5) Behavioral therapies (exposure, aversion, token economy)

Biological Treatments: Three drug categories identified - (1) Antipsychotics (decrease dopamine, reduce positive schizophrenia symptoms), (2) Antianxiety (reduce anxiety but cause drowsiness/dependence), (3) Antidepressants with 4 classes (Tricyclics, MAO inhibitors, SSRIs, SNRIs). Major criticism: up to 90% effects may be placebo.

Cognitive Therapy Models: (1) REBT (Ellis) uses ABCD model - A=Activating event, B=Belief system, C=Consequences, D=Disputing beliefs. (2) Beck's Cognitive Therapy targets negative automatic thoughts and "Negative Triad". (3) CBT integrates cognitive and behavioral approaches, views thoughts/feelings/behaviors as interconnected.

Carl Rogers' Person-Centered Therapy: Three essential therapist attributes - (1) Unconditional Positive Regard (genuine care without judgment), (2) Empathy (view world through client's eyes), (3) Genuineness (consistency between feelings and behavior). Focus on present/future vs past, emphasizes self-healing capacity.

Behavioral Therapies: Core principle - maladaptive behaviors ARE the problem (not symptoms). Three main techniques: (1) Exposure Therapy (systematic desensitization/flooding for phobias, highly effective), (2) Aversion Therapy (pair attractive stimulus with noxious one, e.g., Clockwork Orange example), (3) Token Economy (positive reinforcement system with exchangeable tokens).

WEEK 11 ANALYSIS COMPLETE: Created 3 comprehensive documents in workspace - (1) week11_treatments_therapies_analysis.md (detailed analysis), (2) week11_json_structure.json (JSON-ready structure), (3) WEEK11_FINAL_DELIVERABLES.md (summary). Extracted 18 key concepts across 5 treatment approaches, 5 learning outcomes, 20 quiz topics, and 3 major examples. All deliverables verified and documented.
